field_edited_text.value:
Domino Sugar’s dock - a water dependent industry











Industrial Activity:

Hundreds of industries are located
around the harbor. Some like shipbuilding
and repair yards are direct outgrowths of
maritime activity. In Baltimore there are
three major concerns involved in the con-
struction, repair, dismantling or conversion
of ships. The largest is the Bethlehem Steel
Co. which employs approximately
20,000 persons - its major yards
in Sparrows Point, where all types of
merchant and naval vessels are constructed
and two repair yards, one on Key Highway
and another near Fort McHenry which
have been sold to a development com-
pany. The Sparrows Point yard is unique
not only as one of the world’s largest ship-
yards but also in its location on the
grounds of a major steel mill, which allows
it to make components to order and
deliver them directly to vessels under
construction.

)

Packing oyster shells

Other industries, while not direct out-
growths of maritime activity, are located on
the harbor because proximity to the water
is essential either for the shipment of their
raw materials and finished products or for a
particular manufacturing process. Examples
of this type of industry are manufacturers
like Bethlehem Steel Sparrows Point,
Amstar Sugar, and U.S. Gypsum; petroleum
products importers like Exxon, Apex, and
Chevron; and chemical firms like Conoco,
Olin Corporation, and Allied Chemicals.





21

Maryland Port Administration
